content: adorable ruffles designed by sharon maher laughing purple goldfish designs copyright 2008 fits 2/3 year old yarns required - whatever you have on hand - cotton would be the most comfortable choice for a sun hat - i have used pink cotton and a fine green ribbon yarn for the body of the hat and some assorted pink remnants for the trim also - 4 0 mm crochet hook - wool needle - buttons to embellish the flower if desired let s begin using both yarns together work in double_crochet throughout start with a magic magic_ring round 1 chain 2 then 11 double_crochet into ring… tighten ring and join to top of starting chains with a slip_stitch… 12 round 2 increase in every stitch… 24 round 3 increase in every 2nd stitch… 36 round 4 increase in every 3rd stitch… 48 round 5 increase in every 4th stitch… 60 round 6 7 and 8 double_crochet in every stitch… 60 change colour for band… if desired i used 3 strands of green ribbon yarn round 9 10 and 11 double_crochet in every stitch… 60 change back to pink and green for brim round 12 increase in every 2nd stitch… 90 round 13 increase in every 3rd stitch… 120 round 14 increase in every 4th stitch… 150 round 15 increase in every 5th stitch… 180 now for the edging single_crochet around brim using only 1 strand of green yarn flower use one strand of dark pink yarn start with a magic magic_ring round 1 - chain 2 9 double_crochet… 10 tighten ring and join to top of starting chains with a slip_stitch round 2 chain 6 * miss one single_crochet in next st chain 5 * to end join with slip_stitch to starting chain round 3 chain half_double_crochet double_crochet trb double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in first 5 chain space then single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet trb double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in each 5ch space to end join with slip_stitch to starting chain change to light pink single_crochet in every stitch around blanket stitch around outside using green ribbon yarn attach buttons to centre of flower fold up brim of hat and attach flower as illustrated i also used dark pink yarn to add a simple embroidery detail around the edge of the brim
